label: Owner ID
definition: The unique identifier of the owner responsible for managing the contact. This dimension allows for analyzing contacts based on the assigned owner.

label: Region
definition: The geographic region associated with the contact. This dimension enables segmenting contacts based on their location, such as North America, Europe, or Asia-Pacific.

label: Segment
definition: The market segment or industry vertical to which the contact belongs. This dimension allows for categorizing contacts based on their business domain or target market.

label: Account Region
definition: The geographic region associated with the account related to the opportunity. This dimension enables analyzing opportunities based on the account's location.

label: Account Segment
definition: The market segment or industry vertical to which the account associated with the opportunity belongs. This dimension allows for categorizing opportunities based on the account's business domain.

label: Account Territory
definition: The sales territory assigned to the account associated with the opportunity. This dimension enables analyzing opportunities based on the account's designated sales coverage.

label: Billing Plan
definition: The billing arrangement or pricing model associated with the opportunity. This dimension allows for distinguishing opportunities based on different billing plans, such as monthly, annual, or usage-based.

label: Billing Term
definition: The duration or length of the billing cycle associated with the opportunity. This dimension enables analyzing opportunities based on the billing frequency, such as monthly, quarterly, or yearly terms.

label: Contract Duration Months
definition: The length of the contract associated with the opportunity, measured in months. This dimension allows for categorizing opportunities based on the commitment duration, such as 12 months, 24 months, or 36 months.

label: Customer Success Manager Name
definition: The name of the customer success manager assigned to the opportunity. This dimension enables analyzing opportunities based on the responsible customer success representative.

label: Forecast Category
definition: The forecasted likelihood of the opportunity closing, typically categorized as Pipeline, Best Case, Commit, or Closed. This dimension allows for assessing the quality and probability of opportunities.

label: Lead Source
definition: The originating source or channel of the lead associated with the opportunity. This dimension enables tracking the effectiveness of different lead generation methods, such as web, referral, or events.

label: Loss Reason
definition: The primary reason for losing the opportunity, such as price, competition, or timing. This dimension provides insights into the factors contributing to lost deals and helps identify areas for improvement.

label: Opportunity Source
definition: The source or origin of the opportunity, indicating how it was generated, such as inbound, outbound, or partner. This dimension allows for analyzing the effectiveness of different opportunity generation strategies.
